instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-4924 Won't Recognize Battery
threads.message:
Got Pro Retina board that boots fine but will not recognize battery.
History: was liquid damaged, completely dead, cleaned by someone, but that only brought it back to power on without charging/running off battery.

ISL current sensing circuits are good: 17/18 are .1ohm/2.3ohm; 27/28 are 10.1/10.4 ohms (no breaks in traces to ISL).
Replaced ISL already.

Reflowed SMC because it looked like someone tried to reflow it already (poorly I might add).

It will now run off the battery, but is not detected in the OS. Tested known good battery and same thing.

SDA and SCL lines test at .47~ in diode mode (red on ground, black on probe), and I know that it's supposed to be somewhere around .57/.59. Voltage is 3.4 but drops to 3.2-3.3 every second or so.
Replaced D7050 in case that was bad, no go. I don't think the ISL is pulling it down. No broken traces under microscope (from R5380 and R5381 to SMC).

Can I get a consensus that it's probably the SMC? Or am I missing something pretty obvious? I don't think it's crap under the battery connector, but it very well could be?

threads.title: 820-4924 Won't Recognize Battery
threads.message: Voltage on PPBUS without the battery just charger?

threads.title: 820-4924 Won't Recognize Battery
threads.message:
You should note these droping pulses on battery bus, as normal behaviour.
An o-scope can confirm the activity there.
However, I would test known good SMC on it.
